item.title: Shelli add a quote by Dolly Parton
item.description: "Find out who you are and do it on purpose." -- Dolly Parton

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Julia Quinn
item.description: "He wondered if she'd mind if he threw her down on the blanket and tore off her clothing. (..) She looked heartbreakingly innocent. Alex sighed. She'd probably mind." -- Julia Quinn

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Shana Abe
item.description: "I heard what you said. I’m not the silly romantic you think. I don’t want the heavens or the shooting stars. I don’t want gemstones or gold. I have those things already. I want…a steady hand. A kind soul. I want to fall asleep, and wake, knowing my heart is safe. I want to love, and be loved." -- Shana Abe

item.title: Shelli add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "He that hath a beard is more than a youth, and he that hath no beard is less than a man. He that is more than a youth is not for me, and he that is less than a man, I am not for him." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Shelli add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "I would challenge you to a battle of wits, but I see you are unarmed!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Shelli add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Julia Quinn
item.description:
"Men are sheep. Where one goes, the rest will soon follow.
-Lady Whistledown" -- Julia Quinn

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "When the day shall come that we do part," he said softly, and turned to look at me, "if my last words are not 'I love you'-ye'll ken it was because I didna have time." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "You are mine, always, if ye will it or no, if ye want me or nay. Mine, and I willna let ye go" -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The Very first moment I beheld him, my heart was irrevocably gone." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "Do ye not understand?"he said, in near desparation. "I would lay the world at your feet, Claire-and I have nothing to give ye!" He honestly thought it mattered." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "Oh, Claire, ye do break my heart wi' loving you." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "Agnostics are just atheists without balls." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "Baby carrots are making me gay." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Shelli add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "I like this place and could willingly waste my time in it." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "Atheism, a religion dedicated to its own sense of smug superiority." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I talk to you as I talk to my own soul," he said, turning me to face him. He reached up and cupped my cheek, fingers light on my temple. "And Sassenach," he whispered, "Your face is my heart." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Life is to be enjoyed, not endured" -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I can bear pain myself, he said softly, but I couldna bear yours. That would take more strength than I have." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "Lying on the floor, with the carved panels of the ceiling flickering dimly above, I found myself thinking that I had always heretofore assumed that the tendency of eigh­teenth-century ladies to swoon was due to tight stays; now I rather thought it might be due to the idiocy of eighteenth-century men. " -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Jenkin Lloyd Jones
item.description: "Anyone who imagines that bliss is normal is going to waste a lot of time running around shouting that he has been robbed. The fact is that most putts don’t drop, most beef is tough, most children grow up to be just like people, most successful marriages require a high degree of mutual toleration, and most jobs are more often dull than otherwise. Life is just like an old time rail journey ... delays, sidetracks, smoke, dust, cinders, and jolts, interspersed only occasionally by beautiful vistas and thrilling bursts of speed. The trick is to thank the Lord for letting you have the ride." -- Jenkin Lloyd Jones

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "Oh, aye, Sassenach. I am your master . . . and you're mine. Seems I canna possess your soul without losing my own." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "You're tearin' my guts out, Claire." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Shelli add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "Murtagh was right about women. Sassenach, I risked my life for ye, committing theft, arson, assault, and murder into the bargain. In return for which ye call me names, insult my manhood, kick me in the ballocks and claw my face. Then I beat you half to death and tell ye all the most humiliating things have ever happened to me, and ye say ye love me." He laid his head on his knees and laughed some more. Finally he rose and held out a hand to me, wiping his eyes with the other. "You're no verra sensible, Sassenach, but I like ye fine. Let's go." -- Diana Gabaldon
